_header: For you my lady I am nigh slain
Note:
Ringler Jr. (1992)
XRingler Jr., William A. Bibliography and Index of English Verse in Manuscript 1501-1558. London: Mansell, 1992; prepared and completed by Michael Rudick and Susan J. Ringler , TM 430.
_description: Humfrey Newton, To his mistress — four quatrains with refrain, ‘for ye haue my hert for euer more’

BodLatMisC66.First Lines:
for you my lady I am neȝ slaynfor thoȝtes greue me verray
                    sore…
BodLatMisC66.Last Lines:
…[Þerfore] my payn is more & morebot in tyme [I wot
                    ye will weake]for ye haue my hert for euer more
BodLatMisC66.Note:
Last few lines at bottom edge of page where wear has made them mostly
                    illegible.
BodLatMisC66.Editions:
Robbins,  Rossell Hope. 
             “The Poems of Humphrey Newton, Esquire, 1466-1536.” 
             PMLA
         65 (1950): 249-81: 274-5.
